title: What is the history and status of the saying 'Mess with the best - die like the rest'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Its first use seems to be with Green Beret Army special forces in the late 60s. The Special Forces community adopted it during the 70s, and by the 80s it was in fairly common use. Marines love it and have shirts made with crossed M16 and skulls, and you can find it here: Amazon.com : Sportsworld MARINES Mess with the Best Die like the Rest Flag - Heavy Duty : Outdoor Flags : Garden & Outdoor Hackers took the phrase and put it in the mouth of Angelina Jolie’s character, but it’s origin is about 2 decades before the movie came out in 1995.

Even though I am British, I've always admired the United States Marine Corps and the saying is one of theirs, along with "semper fi, semper fi, the Marine Corps way is do or die". No idea who started it - hopefully a marine veteran will enlighten us.
